bugs.title: CVE-2022-26563 monit: privilege escalation due to improper PAM-authorization

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-26563 monit: privilege escalation due to improper PAM-authorization

long_desc.thetext:
Monit could be made to bypass authentication checks for disabled accounts. An attacker could possibly use this issue to login to the platform with an expired account and a valid password.

https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-23pc-hgf6-6wwr
https://bitbucket.org/tildeslash/monit/commits/6ecaab1d375f33165fe98d06d92f36c949c0ea11

Created monit tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2257636]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2257637]

bugs.title: CVE-2022-26563 monit: privilege escalation due to improper PAM-authorization [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-26563 monit: privilege escalation due to improper PAM-authorization

long_desc.thetext:
Monit could be made to bypass authentication checks for disabled accounts. An attacker could possibly use this issue to login to the platform with an expired account and a valid password.

https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-23pc-hgf6-6wwr
https://bitbucket.org/tildeslash/monit/commits/6ecaab1d375f33165fe98d06d92f36c949c0ea11

Created monit tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2257636]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2257637]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2257635

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=high

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2257635,2257636

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
FEDORA-EPEL-2024-be7448f09b has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 8. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2024-be7448f09b
EPEL9 is unaffected as it already had v5.32.0. EPEL7 has ppc64le build issues moving to v5.33.0 so I am testing a backported patch for v5.30.0.
FEDORA-EPEL-2024-cc00d17a57 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2024-cc00d17a57

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2024-be7448f09b

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-EPEL-2024-cc00d17a57 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 testing repository.

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2024-cc00d17a57

FEDORA-EPEL-2024-be7448f09b has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 8 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

FEDORA-EPEL-2024-cc00d17a57 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.
